bio.experienceSummary:
Hi! I have 15+ years of experience providing care for infants and children. In addition to nannying, I've worked in daycares, and taught art classes in after-school programs and summer camps. Over the past year I've worked for several families in Brooklyn providing care for infants (as young as 3 months), and toddlers. I'm very comfortable with multiples and am open to every child's individual needs. As a care provider, safety is my upmost priority, followed by having fun and embracing creativity. Families I've worked with have described me as patient, warm, and flexible.

A little bit about me- I'm in my 30's, and in addition to being a nanny, I'm a professional visual artist working with a gallery in NYC. I grew up alongside a neurodiverse family member and have experience teaching art to neurodiverse adults, teens and children. I'm also a very active person and love being outside at Prospect Park and the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

description.originalText: Lydia is delightful to work with. She has  a kind and warm presence. We have worked together several times (both during the day and at night) and she had my 11 month old immediately at ease and enthralled with playtime. We hope to work with Lydia many more times!

bio.experienceSummary:
My name is Katie, I graduated with my bachelors in 2021, and currently work a 9-5. I used to be a live-in and live-out nanny and occasional babysitter throughout high school and college. A lot of people would describe me as caring, hard working, a problem solver and emotionally intelligent. Most importantly, I want to be a role model for your children and help them and you in any way possible. I love working with all ages of kids, and have experience working for children with special needs. 

I live in Astoria, Queens and am willing to travel throughout NYC.

description.originalText:
Katherine M. took great care of our two children for nearly two years.  She was always a good example of kindness and respect for others with her mild-mannered ways.
Katherine helped with homework, meals/snacks, shuttled them to parks, aquarium, ice cream parlor etc.,  and was someone we could always rely on to pick our kids from school.  Safety was always first on the road or in our home.  
Katherine M. was flexible with her schedule and helped out on short notices multiple times.
Conducts herself professionally, extremely honest, caring, responsible, friendly and we 
recommend her 100%.

bio.experienceSummary: I've always leaned into psychology and education, and the ways that the two are so deeply intertwined. Having extensive experience with all ages between infancy and adolescence, I am still consistently thrilled to experience the myriad ways that we can support their development. My first paying job was babysitting for children in the neighborhood, but the real foundation of my experience in intentional childcare was working at a summer camp in a local nature preserve. My experience includes running elementary-aged outdoor programs, nonprofit community programs for teenagers, and most recently, working in the Infant/Toddler program at a Montessori school. I love to encourage agency- regardless of age, all young people benefit from the opportunity to make mistakes within a safe set of boundaries. My greatest strength is my authenticity, engaging with all children carrying a sense of curiosity and wonder.

Hi! I'm Mae, so nice to meet you!
I'm now living in Brooklyn with my two dogs. I've always had a passion for childcare, and grew up with 3 younger siblings who I helped care for when living at home. 
My experience ranges from infants to children ages 12+, and I am also fluent in Hebrew and love working with bilingual families!
I'm comfortable and more than happy to help with cooking, basic housekeeping, laundry, and errands, if needed.
Additionally, I love the arts! I'm a folk musician, and have experience teaching young kids guitar, ukulele and piano, as well as basic voice lessons. I also enjoy sports, and have played Soccer, Volleyball, Basketball and was even on a Roller Derby team in the past.

Hi! I'm Jill and I have more than 10 years of experience caring for and working with children of all ages. I was a camp counselor at a sleepaway camp for 7 years, creating safe, fun and interactive environments for children ages 8 to 15 and teaching them a range of activities. I am high-energy, imaginative, silly and love to create structure and build routines. I am a firm believer of letting kids be kids and encouraging them to build independence and confidence, while always ensuring their safety and well-being through reliable and responsive caretaking.

Hi! I was born and raised in New York City and am currently pursuing a masters in clinical social work at Hunter, with the goal of becoming a child psychotherapist. I am currently completing my clinical internship at a high school providing counseling to teens. Prior to beginning grad school this past fall, I worked as an early childhood teacher at a preschool in the West Village with children from infancy through age 5. I graduated from Washington University in St Louis in 2022 where I studied women, gender, and sexuality studies, children's studies, and art. I have many years of experience with children working in multiple capacities, including babysitting, early literacy tutoring, and as a full-time teacher. I have particular interests in art and music education and worked as an art and music teacher for young children for many years. I am looking for part or full-time babysitting for summer 2025.

I am currently a Kindergarten teacher in Flushing, NY. I have experience with children from 1 year to 13 years of age. I absolutely love what I do and always make it a goal to keep children entertained, well-fed, clean, and most importantly, safe. It is vital to create a comfortable relationship with the child and families, allowing them to know I am a reliable, patient, and responsible adult. I maintain a fun and engaging environment. I believe children learn through play and I always encourage their minds to explore and discover, as they grow. I enjoy dress-up, super heroes, Arts and Crafts, reading and more! I enjoy being outdoors, playing sports, riding bikes, & playground visits- weather permitting. I can assist with homework and tutoring. I am available for date night and occasional sitting. Thank you!

description.displayText: Mabel was recommended to me through a family friend when I needed someone to watch my two year old daughter after my mother in law moved out of state. Let me start by saying she is very warm and nurturing, my daughter took to her immediately! I could tell within the first few minutes watching their interaction that she genuinely enjoys being around children which put my nerves at ease. Throughout the day, she send pictures and videos to show me how my little one is doing, a detail I greatly appreciated. My daughter loves hearing that Mabel is coming over and starts jumping with joy when she arrives. They play together (she doesn't just turn the TV on all night THANK GOODNESS) and by the time I come home, her room is clean and she's tucked into bed. I highly highly recommend her!
description.originalText: Mabel was recommended to me through a family friend when I needed someone to watch my two year old daughter after my mother in law moved out of state. bio.experienceSummary:
I am fully vaccinated for COVID-19.

I have eight years of childcare experience and am located in Midtown Manhattan. I am currently attending Harvard University part-time, pursuing a dual degree in Business with a minor in Child Development and Public Health. For the past three years, I have been working in the tech-healthcare and startup industries, while also babysitting, nannying, and volunteering during my undergraduate studies.

I am well-versed in Montessori learning and curriculum. I love working with children and have experience with newborns, toddlers, and adolescents alike.

I am passionate about caring for kids and look forward to hearing from you! :)

description.originalText: Makalah has been amazing nanny for my twin baby girls. Todd and I loved her attentiveness and affection she gave to our babies. She was always on time and notify us in advance if she needed to leave early or come in later. I highly recommend her to any family!

bio.experienceSummary:
As a caregiver, my passion lies in nurturing the growth and development of young minds. With over a decade of experience, I've had the joy of caring for children of various ages, from infants to preteens. My patient, creative, and approachable nature allows me to connect with children and create a safe and stimulating environment.


I believe in open communication with parents and strive to keep them informed about their child's day through daily reports and verbal communication at pickup. I also respect and adhere to the household rules set by the parents.

My approach to childcare involves a mix of outdoor activities, board games, and educational games that foster learning and fun. I'm dedicated to providing a nurturing and enriching experience for each child in my care.

I am fluent in both Arabic and English and am comfortable caring for up to two children at a time.

Hi! My name is Martyna and I am a 27-year-old actress, musician and teacher. 
I absolutely love kids and have been taking care of them since I was a young teenager. I recently moved from Florida and am looking for a part time nanny position with a sweet family. I work part-time at The Spence School on the UES so hoping to find a family close by. 
Being a creative, I am always looking for fun and engaging activities to keep kids occupied. I have experience with children of all ages as young as 6 months and I run my own music school in FL and now expanding into NYC. I also offer private piano, voice and music classes! 
References are available upon requests. Hoping to find a caring, fun-loving family!

description.displayText: Martyna has been an amazing nanny to our one year old twins.  She is very interactive with the girls and attentive to their needs.  She is such a hard worker and has an amazing work ethic.  We are so grateful to have found her!
description.originalText: Martyna has been an amazing nanny to our one year old twins.  She is very interactive with the girls and attentive to their needs.  She is such a hard worker and has an amazing work ethic.  We are so grateful to have found her!
